subject: All Star Games
lead_paragraph: Carlos Delgado’s first half caused much consternation for Mets fans. And his recent hot streak has not calmed their fears, because he had shown glimpses of his old form, only to grow cold again. But Delgado, right, has been here before. In 2004, he had 10 homers, 36 runs batted in and a .223 average at the All-Star Game break. Delgado hit .305 the rest of the way and finished with 32 home runs and 99 R.B.I.
